Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'MySqlCommand.CommandText.set(string)' in 'QueryKitbox.ColumnList(MySqlConnection, string)' could contain the following variables 'Column'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'MySqlCommand.CommandText.set(string)' in 'QueryKitbox.SpecsBoxList(MySqlConnection, string, string)' could contain the following variables 'SelectSQL', 'WhereSQL'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'MySqlCommand.CommandText.set(string)' in 'QueryKitbox.UpdateDbComponents(MySqlConnection, string, string)' could contain the following variables 'SetSQL', 'WhereSQL'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Name: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Description: A correctly implemented Dispose method can be called multiple times without throwing an exception. However, this is not guaranteed and to avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.
Rule.Resolution: Object {0} can be disposed more than once in method {1}. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 29, 37, 46, 47

Rule.Name: Mark Windows Forms entry points with STAThread
Rule.Description: Assemblies that reference System.Windows.Forms should have the STAThreadAttribute. Failure to apply this attribute will most likely result in an application that does not work. Windows Forms relies on a number of components that use the STA model.
Rule.Resolution: Mark the entry point method {0} in assembly {1} with an STAThreadAttribute.

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.
